id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID with which you will be able to reference the animation later in your display code.

*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/animation.html#configuration-variables)*

loop.docs:
If you want to loop over a subset of your animation (e.g. a fire animation where the fire “starts”, then “burns” and “dies”) you can specify some frames to loop over.
  * **start_frame** (*Optional*, int): The frame to loop back to when `end_frame` is reached. Defaults to the first frame in the animation.
  
  * **end_frame** (*Optional*, int): The last frame to show in the loop; when this frame is reached it will loop back to `start_frame`. Defaults to the last frame in the animation.
  
  * **repeat** (*Optional*, int): Specifies how many times the loop will run. When the count is reached, the animation will continue with the next frame after `end_frame`, or restart from the beginning if `end_frame` was the last frame. Defaults to “loop forever”.
  
  

*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/animation.html#configuration-variables)*

**, string**: If set, this will resize all the frames to fit inside the given dimensions `WIDTHxHEIGHT` and preserve the aspect ratio.

transparency.docs:
If set the alpha channel of the input image will be taken into account. The possible values are `opaque` (default), `chroma_key` and `alpha_channel`. See discussion on transparency in the [image component](https://esphome.io/components/image.html#display-image).

*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/animation.html#configuration-variables)*

type.docs:
Specifies how to encode image internally. See the [image component](https://esphome.io/components/image.html#display-image) for more information.
  * `BINARY`: Two colors, suitable for 1 color displays or 2 color image in color displays. Uses 1 bit per pixel, 8 pixels per byte. Only `chroma_key` transparency is available.
  
  * `GRAYSCALE`: Full scale grey. Uses 8 bits per pixel, 1 pixel per byte.
  
  * `RGB565`: Lossy RGB color stored. Uses 2 bytes per pixel, 3 with an alpha channel.
  
  * `RGB`: Full RGB color stored. Uses 3 bytes per pixel, 4 with an alpha channel.
  
  

*See also: [Animation](https://esphome.io/components/animation.html#configuration-variables)*
